card_answer:
###To agree is to have the same opinion or belief as another person.

---

_The students agree they have too much homework._

###Alcohol is a type of drink that can make people drunk.

---

_A person should not drive a car after he or she has been drinking alcohol._

###To arrive is to get somewhere.

---

_They arrived at school at 7 a.m._

###August is the eighth month of the year.

---

_Is your birthday in August?_

###A boat is a vehicle that moves across water.

---

_There is a small boat on the lake._

###Breakfast is the morning meal.

---

_I ate eggs for breakfast._

###A camera is a piece of equipment that takes pictures.

---

_I brought my camera on my vacation._

###A capital is a city where a country’s government is based.

---

_The capital of the United States is Washington, D.C._

###To catch is to grab or get something.

---

_Did you catch the ball during the baseball game?_

###A duck is a small water bird.

---

_People feed ducks at the lake._

###To enjoy is to like something.

---

_The woman enjoys riding her bicycle._

###To invite is to ask someone to come to a place or event.

---

_I will invite my friends to my birthday party._

###To love is to like something or someone a lot.

---

_I love my family very much._

###A month is one of 12 periods of time in one year.

---

_January is the first month of the year._

###To travel is to go to a faraway place on vacation or business.

---

_They will travel to Argentina this summer._

###If something is typical, it is normal, or something that usually happens.

---

_My typical breakfast is toast and eggs._

###To visit is to go and spend time in another place or see another person.

---

_She wants to visit her grandmother._

###Weather is the temperature and the state of the outdoors.

---

_Today’s weather is rainy and cloudy._

###A week is a period of time that is seven days long.

---

_What are you doing next week?_

###Wine is an alcoholic drink made from grapes.

---

_The store carried both red and white wine._

###An adventure is a fun or exciting thing that you do.

---

_Riding in the rough water was an adventure._

###To approach something means to move close to it.

---

_The boy approached his school._

###Carefully means with great attention, especially to detail or safety.

---

_The baby carefully climbed down the stairs._

###A chemical is something that scientists use in chemistry.

---

_The scientist mixed the chemicals._

###To create means to make something new.

---

_She created an igloo from blocks of snow._

###Evil describes something or someone bad or cruel, not good.

---

_They felt a strange, evil presence as they got closer to the house._

###An experiment is a test that you do to see what will happen.

---

_The student did an experiment in science class._

###To kill someone or something is to make them die.

---

_I killed the fly._

###A laboratory is a room where a scientist works.

---

_My mother works in a laboratory._

###Laugh is the sound made when someone is happy or a funny thing occurs.

---

_The sound of her laugh filled the room._

###If a sound is loud, it is strong and very easy to hear.

---

_The man’s voice was so loud that we all could hear him._

###When a person is nervous, they think something bad will happen.

---

_The boy became nervous when he heard the news._

###A noise is an unpleasant sound.

---

_The crying baby made a loud noise._

###A project is a type of work that you do for school or a job.

---

_His afternoon work project was to paint the room green._

###To scare someone is to make them feel afraid.

---

_My uncle was scared by what he saw in the room._

###A secret is something that you do not tell other people.

---

_The two boys were sharing a secret._

###To shout is to say something loudly.

---

_My boss shouted at me because I was late for work._

###To smell something means to use your nose to sense it.

---

_The two friends smelled the flower._

###If something is terrible, it is very bad.

---

_The way he treated his classmate was terrible._

###If something is worse, it is of poorer quality than another thing.

---

_Business was worse this month than last month._

###An alien is a creature from a different world.

---

_The alien came in peace._

###If you are among certain things, they are all around you.

---

_There was a red apple among the green ones._

###A chart is a list of information.

---

_We used a chart to see how we had improved._

###A cloud is a group of water drops in the sky.

---

_The sky was filled with white clouds._

###To describe is to say or write what someone or something is like.

---

_They described their tree as colorful, with gold ribbon and a star._

###Ever means at any time.

---

_Going skiing last winter was the most fun I’ve ever had._

###To fail means you do not succeed in what you try to do.

---

_Since he failed to get the job, he was sad._

###A grade is a score or mark given to someone’s work.

---

_I managed to get good grades on my report card._

###Instead means in place of.

---

_He ate the carrot instead of the ice cream._

###A library is a place where you go to read books.

---

_The library at school is full of books._

###I like taking photographs.

---

_I took this photograph with my cell phone._

###A planet is a large round thing in space.

---

_Saturn is the planet with the ring around it._

###A report is something someone writes for school or work.

---

_Karen had trouble writing her report._

###Several is more than two but not many.

---

_He had to read several books for class._

###An object’s shape is the arrangement of its sides and surfaces.

---

_Even with your eyes closed you can feel the shape of it._

###To solve something is to find an answer to it.

---

_All the students could easily solve the math problem._

###If something happens suddenly, it happens quickly and unexpectedly.

---

_I was surprised when my friends suddenly shouted, “Happy birthday!”_

###To suppose is to guess.

---

_I suppose I should go home now._

###To understand something you need to know what it means.

---

_Henry could not understand the message._

###To view is to look at something.

---

_Michael likes to view himself in the mirror._

###When a thing is appropriate, it is right or normal.

---

_It’s appropriate to wear a suit when you go to the office._

###To avoid something is to stay away from it.

---

_Avoid the broken bottle on the floor._

###To behave is to act in a particular way, especially to be good.

---

_She always behaves well when her father is around._

###When someone is calm, they do not get excited or upset.

---

_A nice warm bath makes me feel so calm._

###Concern is a feeling of worry.

---

_I was filled with concern after reading the newspaper._

###To be content is to be happy and not want more.

---

_The baby looked very content sitting on the floor._

###If you expect something to happen, you believe it will happen.

---

_I expect the bus to be here very soon._

###When something happens frequently, it happens often.

---

_We meet frequently, either at the beginning or end of the week._

###A habit is a thing that you do often.

---

_Smoking is a bad habit that can kill you._

###To instruct is to teach.

---

_My teacher instructs us in several subjects._

###An issue is an important topic.

---

_The men spoke about issues that were important to the people._

###None means not any of something.

---

_He spent all his money. There is none left._

###If people are patient, they don’t become angry or upset easily.

---

_I had to be patient and wait until 5 o’clock to leave._

###If something is positive, it is good.

---

_She has a positive future ahead of her after finishing college._

###To punish means to make someone suffer for breaking the rules or laws.

---

_To punish me, my teacher had me stand in the corner._

###To represent is to speak or act for a person or group.

---

_My lawyer will represent me in court._

###To shake is to move back and forth or up and down quickly.

---

_When people shake hands, it usually means they agree._

###To spread is to move out to cover a larger area.

---

_I like to spread butter on my toast._

###To stroll means to walk slowly and calmly.

---

_My dog and I strolled through the park today._

###A village is a very small town.

---

_There are only a few houses in my village._

###When someone is active, they move a lot or have a lot of things to do.

---

_It is important to be active and not sit around all the time._

###An adult is a person who is more than 18 years old.

---

_My mom and dad are adults._

###Age is how many years someone has lived.

---

_She died at the age of 80._

###When something is bad, it is not good.

---

_She is unhappy because she had a bad day._

###Balance is when two or more things are equal.

---

_A good balance between work and fun helps keep you healthy._

###A bike is a vehicle with two wheels powered by a human.

---

_He rides his bike to school every day._

###To choose is to pick something or make a decision.

---

_I have to choose between taking art classes and sports lessons._

###A doctor is a person who studies medicine and helps sick people.

---

_You should go to the doctor when you are sick._

###During an event means while the event was happening.

---

_Did you sleep during the movie?_

###Football is a sport with eleven members and an oval-shaped ball.

---

_Football is a popular sport in the United States._

###When something is fun, it is enjoyable.

---

_We had a fun time at the birthday party._

###A game is an activity where people compete against each other.

---

_Let’s play a board game tonight._

###A heart is an organ that keeps the body alive.

---

_My heart beats fast when I am nervous._

###Golf is a sport with clubs and a small white ball.

---

_People play golf in nice weather._

###To increase is to make something larger.

---

_I will increase my score if I study for the test._

###Life is the time when a person is alive.

---

_My grandfather had a long life._

###A kilometer is a unit of measurement that is 1,000 meters.

---

_A marathon is 42.2 kilometers._

###Often is when something happens many times.

---

_He often goes to bed early during the week._

###If you have plenty of something, there is a lot of it.

---

_We have plenty of fruit, so help yourself._

###Weight is how heavy something or someone is.

---

_I gained weight because I ate a lot of pizza._
